item.description:
下午6点到晚上8点

Hongbo Wu, a researcher in pulmonary oncology at DFCI (Dana Farber Cancer Institute) in the Longwood Medical Area, will speak in Mandarin on medical, social, economic, and public policy issues around lung cancer - diagnosis, causes, treatment, roles of genetics and behavior, and the importance of truth-seeking in both research and personal behavior as a basis for personal and public policy.

General discussion from 6-7 pm and a DISCUSSION TOPIC at 7 pm

The schedule:
6:00 - 7:00 pm - General Discussion - BOTH Mandarin & English
7:00 - 7:30 pm - FOCUSED DISCUSSION TOPIC (talk IN MANDARIN by knowledgeable person) - maybe some English phrases
7:30 - 8:00 pm - Mandarin discussion of Mandarin talk

 

Hongbo Wu, a researcher in pulmonary oncology at DFCI (Dana Farber Cancer Institute) in the Longwood Medical Area, will speak in Mandarin on medical, social, economic, and public policy issues around lung cancer - diagnosis, causes, treatment, roles of genetics and behavior, and the importance of truth-seeking in both research and personal behavior as a basis for personal and public policy.

The TUESDAY evening event is ALWAYS in the Longwood Medical Area.

it's OK to be late (but better NOT to be) and OK to leave early
Eat beforehand (or bring your food).

If there are questions, (a) read the posting and (b) call ME on my GoogleVoice (617-615-9672).

Everyone without a Harvard ID
needs to E-Mail Maynard.Clark@GMail.com
to request an HSPH building pass to get into the chat.
